properties.media:imagetext:
The wines served aboard United's flights are chosen in consultation
with Doug Frost, columnist and author (On Wine, 2001; Uncorking Wine, 1996).
Mr. Frost has been nominated for the prestigious James Beard Foundation Award
and is one of only three people in the world to hold both the title of Master Sommelier
and Master of Wine. Mr. Frost and United Airlines have taken a truly global perspective
in selecting wines for your appreciation and enjoyment. À votre santé!
featured wines
Your flight attendant will inform you of today's selections.
Some of these wines may only be available on selected flights.
Champagne
Pol Roger Brut NV Champagne
Pol Roger enjoys a reputation as one of the most consistent producers in Champagne,
creating a sparkling wine that is wildly rich and still balanced. That balance allows play
between fruitiness and earthiness: nutty, rich and juicy, with toast, pear and apple flavors
at the very long end.
Pommery Brut Royal NV Champagne
Pommery creates one of the most elegant of Champagnes, and their Brut Royal
always exhibits grace and softness. Elegance doesn't have to preclude complexity;
their classic wine shows gentle pear, lemon and earth flavors.
White Wine
Labouré-Roi 2004 Chablis (Chardonnay)
Where California goes for the richness of buttered toast with its Chardonnays, Chablis (a
subregion of Burgundy) is poised, earthy and tart with orange and green apple aromas.
Domaine Vincent Sauvestre 2004 Chablis (Chardonnay)
Chardonnay is a chameleon of a grape; in California and Australia, it can be gooey and
buttery. But the producers in Chablis (a subregion of Burgundy) seem unconcerned with
Chardonnay's more ample proportions and create a leaner, stonier version of the grape.
Powers Chardonnay 2003 Columbia Valley
While California has built a reputation on buttery Chardonnay, Washington's best
Chardonnays have even better balance between richness and crispness,
combining spiced pears and buttered toast, such as this beauty from Powers.
Van Loveren Sauvignon Blanc 2005 Robertson
While New Zealand has become famous for a dramatic and herbal style of
Sauvignon Blanc, the best versions of that grape in South Africa tend to be
more restrained and balanced.
Red Wine
E. Guigal 2001 Côtes du Rhône
Guigal enjoys a reputation as one of the benchmark producers in the Rhône Valley.
With the grapes Grenache and Syrah in the mix, the aromas are of raspberries
and red cherries, and the flavors are powerful, chocolatey and warm.
Taurus Roble Tempranillo 2003 Toro
Spain is the hot new thing in the international marketplace, even though they've been
making wine for a few thousand years. The grape used, Tempranillo, seems to be able
to make traditional and soft wine as well as lush, juicy New World-styled wines,
such as this one
Lockwood Merlot 2002 Monterey
In the last few years, some remarkable Merlots have been coming out of Monterey.
The wine starts soft and friendly, with blueberries and chocolate, the flavors and power
seem to grow and the finish goes on and on.
Clos du Bois Zinfandel 2003 North Coast
Zinfandel has a sweet spot on the planet, it's the northern part of Sonoma.
It has intensity of fruit allied with the spice of American oak.
Warburn Premium Reserve Shiraz 2005 Southeastern Australia
Warburn offers an ideal example of the character of Australian Shiraz,
with coconut, blackberry and cassis flavors.
Beverages
Apéritifs, cocktails, spirits, liqueurs and beer
Sandeman Founders Reserve Porto will be offered during the main meal's dessert.
STARBUCKS. coffee will be available throughout the flight.
291C001-2
to begin
Dried beef and marinated prawns with asparagus tips and tomato*
Mustard dill mayonnaise
Fresh seasonal greens
Creamy wasabi or raspberry vinaigrette
main course
Pan-seared filet mignon with shallot balsamic demi-glace*
Potato mushroom casserole and sautéed vegetables with shiitake mushrooms
Oven-roasted breast of chicken with blueberry peppercorn sauce
White and wild rice medley, blanched broccoli and roasted pumpkin
Fillet of salmon with lemon myrtle cream sauce
Parslied château potatoes and a mixed vegetable sauté
Please advise the flight attendant if you prefer to have sauce served on the side
dessert
International cheese selection
Brie, St. Claire
Hazelnut nougat cake
midflight snack
A variety of sandwiches and assorted treats
prior to arrival
Your selected entree will be served
with breakfast breads, butter and fruit preserves
Asparagus and Gouda cheese filled omelette
Grilled smoked chicken, baked Roma tomato half
Fresh seasonal fruit plate with creamy yogurt
* Today's menu features beef from Australia.
We apologize if occasionally your choice is not available.
11/06
SYD-LAX/SFO (LD83-S89-B87)
LOTUUUT C
